intro: Duroia paruensis, commonly known as the Paruense wax palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, fan-shaped leaves that can reach several meters in diameter. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
